text: Jacques Cloutier (born January 3, 1960 in Noranda, Quebec) is a Canadian retired ice hockey goaltender. He currently works as the associate coach for the Calgary Flames. ==Playing career== Before playing in the NHL, Cloutier played 4 seasons in the QMJHL with the Trois Rivieres Draveurs. He was drafted by the Buffalo Sabres with the 55th overall pick in the 1979 NHL Entry draft. He played 144 games with Sabres and 136 games with their AHL affiliate, Rochester Americans. After his time with Sabres, he played 2 seasons with the Chicago Blackhawks and 58 games with the Quebec Nordiques. He retired from playing professional ice hockey in 1994. After retiring, Cloutier became the assistant coach of the Cornwall Aces for 2 seasons, the assistant coach for the goaltending coach for the Quebec Nordiques/Colorado Avalanche for 12 seasons and is the current associate coach of the Calgary Flames. ==References== == Other websites == * Category:1960 births Category:Buffalo Sabres players Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Ice hockey people from Quebec Category:Living people Category:Quebec Nordiques players Category:Rochester Americans players Category:Trois-Rivi√®res Draveurs players
title: Jacques Cloutier
